org.apache.river.qa.harness

Class MergedPolicyProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.security.Policy
      • org.apache.river.api.security.AbstractPolicy
        • org.apache.river.qa.harness.MergedPolicyProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.river.api.security.ScalableNestedPolicy

    public class MergedPolicyProvider
extends org.apache.river.api.security.AbstractPolicy
implements org.apache.river.api.security.ScalableNestedPolicy
    Security policy provider that delegates to a collection of underlying PolicyFileProviders. The resulting policy implements an imperfect union of the underlying policies. For example, if one policy granted read access to a file and another granted write access to the same file, a check for read,write access would still fail.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MergedPolicyProvider

        public MergedPolicyProvider()
                     throws net.jini.security.policy.PolicyInitializationException
        Creates a new MergedPolicyProvider instance that wraps a collection of underlying policies. If the java.security.policy property is defined, it must supply the name of a single security policy file. If the org.apache.river.qa.harness.policies property is defined, it must supply the names of one or more security policy files. The names must be separated by white space and/or commas. A PolicyFileProvider is created for each policy file in the combined set of names.
        Throws:
        net.jini.security.policy.PolicyInitializationException - if unable to construct a policy

      • getPermissionGrants

        public List<org.apache.river.api.security.PermissionGrant> getPermissionGrants(ProtectionDomain domain)
        Description copied from interface: org.apache.river.api.security.ScalableNestedPolicy
        Returns a new List containing immutable PermissionGrant's, the List returned is not synchronised and must not be shared with policy internal state. Only those PermissionGrant's that imply the domain will be returned. If any PermissionGrant's are privileged (contain AllPermission), then only that one PermissionGrant should be added to the collection. If a List has a size of 1, and contains only a privileged PermissionGrant, it enables the calling policy to determine the privileged state quickly. If a policy has a privileged PermissionGrant to add to a Collection, then the Collection must be cleared before the privileged PermissionGrant is added, so the Collection only contains the privileged PermissionGrant. The top level policy gathers all PermissionGrant's, retrieves all relevant permissions, then sorts them using a PermissionComparator, so Permission objects are added to a PermissionCollection in the most efficient order. If a nested base policy doesn't support ScalableNestedPolicy, then the implementer should create a PermissionGrant for the domain, containing the Permission objects returned from the policy. The first nested base policy (usually a file policy provider) is responsible for merging any static Permission objects from the ProtectionDomain.
        Specified by:
        getPermissionGrants in interface org.apache.river.api.security.ScalableNestedPolicy
        Returns:
        Collection
